metadata.title: CVE-2020-10742 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. An index buffer overflow duringDirect IO write leading to the NFS client to crash. In some cases, a reachout of the index after one memory allocation by kmalloc will cause a kernelpanic. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to dataconfidentiality and system availability.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
